thanks to @adbenitez (maintainer of that mastodon bot) for pointing out that OAUTH2 is available too -- so no need to provide your password to the bot. Of course it still sees you interacting which still requires some trust to be put into the operator of the bot.

This @delta account is mediated in a chat group where anyone in the group can reply and see interactions, or follow the "home" chat with posts from the accounts we follow. For implementation see https://github.com/simplebot-org/simplebot_mastodon (also on PyPI) -- the bot needs your credentials so it's best to run this bot in an environment you trust.

If you are curious or interested about bot development then the echo bot repository has example impls in Python, Rust, Javascript/Typescript and even C (but better to use Rust these days ;) https://github.com/deltachat-bot/echo -- and thanks to @adbenitez there are also many more advanced chat bots written as "simplebot" plugins here https://github.com/simplebot-org

Wouldn't it be nice if you could migrate with Delta Chat from one e-mail provider to another and keep all your chats and communications and encryption working seamlessly? With 1.32 Delta Chat releases we added initial support towards this goal on all platforms ü•≥ "Introducing Automatic E-Mail Address Porting (AEAP)". https://delta.chat/en/2022-09-14-aeap

A little tech preview for Delta Chat iOS to easily setup a second device, under the hood using the fast evolving Rust implementation of @IPFS@twitter.com https://github.com/n0-computer/iroh/ -- not the only use we are envisioning of this interesting P2P effort ;)

Some days ago we visited the fine folks behind https://mailcow.email and https://servercow.de -- while mailcow installations already work well with Delta Chat we want to increase speed of message delivery, spam processing and aim for easier onboarding with mailcow installs.
OH "Russia is about as federated as Telegram"

https://webxdc.org apps radically cut out advertising because tracking and targeting is impossible. As an app developer you can not get at user-data at all because all dataflows between user's devices, app data is only shared in the chat between peers, e2e-encrypted.
Oh, and these 500 added lines include quite a number of automated tests as well.

Through these ~500 added lines of Rust code, all Delta Chat apps will grow the ability to seamlessly port their e-mail address from one provider to another. The code's relative simplicity was hard-earned through many prior discusssions https://github.com/deltachat/deltachat-core-rust/pull/3385/files

Sharing Web Apps in a chat: Recent releases of Delta Chat (1.30) semi-silently introduced support for "webxdc", a new way to share and run web apps, without leaking any data to third parties. See https://delta.chat/en/2022-06-14-webxdcintro and https://webxdc.org for demos/quickstarts.
